oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic Agriculture in Austria
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vogl, C. R.
Darnhofer, I.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Values, standards and certification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic farming has a long history in Austria, not least due to the fact that Rudolf Steiner, the founder of the bio-dynamic farming movement, was an Austrian. Currently approximately 10% of Austrian farms are certified organic, the highest percentage in the EU.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Vogl, C. R. and Darnhofer, I. (2004) Organic Agriculture in Austria. The Organic Standard (34), pp. 2-5.
